question: The "Hispaniolan Crossbill" is native and endemic to which two countries?
explanation: Hispaniolan Crossbill is native and endemic to Haiti and the Dominican Republic of the Hispaniola Islands of the Greater Antilles Archipelago of the West Indies-Caribbean region. According to IUCN's Red List of Threatened Species, it is an endangered bird species. This bird exclusively feeds on the seeds of the Hispaniolan pine tree cones. Increased agricultural clearance and habitat loss pose a great threat to the population and the existence of Hispaniolan crossbill.
